member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRows

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The rows from a feature class, layer, table, or table view to be copied. (In, Required)

The table to which the rows will be written. If the output table already exists and the Geoprocessing Option: 'Overwrite the outputs of geoprocessing operations' is checked, it will be overwritten. To prevent overwriting from the tool dialog box, uncheck that option. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The rows from a feature class, layer, table, or table view to be copied. (In, Required)

member.summary: The table to which the rows will be written. If the output table already exists and the Geoprocessing Option: 'Overwrite the outputs of geoprocessing operations' is checked, it will be overwritten. To prevent overwriting from the tool dialog box, uncheck that option. (Out, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures
member.summary: Copies features from the input feature class or layer to a new feature class. If the input is a layer which has a selection, only the selected features will be copied. If the input is a geodatabase feature class or shapefile, all features will be copied.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The features to be copied. (In, Required)

The feature class which will be created and to which the features will be copied. If the output feature class already exists and the overwrite option is set to true, the output will be deleted first. If the output feature class already exists and the overwrite option is set to false, the operation will fail. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.in_features
member.summary: The features to be copied. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class which will be created and to which the features will be copied. If the output feature class already exists and the overwrite option is set to true, the output will be deleted first. If the output feature class already exists and the overwrite option is set to false, the operation will fail. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.config_keyword
member.summary: Geodatabase configuration keyword to be applied if the output is an ArcSDE geodatabase or file geodatabase. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.spatial_grid_1
member.summary: The Spatial Grid 1, 2, and 3 parameters apply only to file geodatabases and certain ArcSDE geodatabase feature classes. If you are unfamiliar with setting grid sizes, leave these options as 0,0,0 and ArcGIS will compute optimal sizes for you. For more information about this parameter, refer to the Add Spatial Index tool documentation. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.spatial_grid_2
member.summary: Cell size of the second spatial grid. Leave the size at 0 if you only want one grid. Otherwise, set the size to at least three times larger than Spatial Grid 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyFeatures.spatial_grid_3
member.summary:
Cell size of the third spatial grid. Leave the size at 0 if you only want two grids. Otherwise, set the size to at least three times larger than Spatial Grid 2.
(In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer
member.summary: Creates a feature layer from an input feature class or layer file. The layer that is created by the tool is temporary and will not persist after the session ends unless the layer is saved to disk or the map document is saved.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer used the make the new layer. Complex feature classes, such as annotation and dimensions, are not valid inputs to this tool. (In, Required)
The name of the feature layer to be created. The newly created layer can be used as input to any geoprocessing tool that accepts a feature layer as input. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer used the make the new layer. Complex feature classes, such as annotation and dimensions, are not valid inputs to this tool. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the feature layer to be created. The newly created layer can be used as input to any geoprocessing tool that accepts a feature layer as input. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer.where_clause
member.summary: An SQL expression used to select a subset of features. The syntax for the expression differs slightly depending on the data source. For example, if you're querying file or ArcSDE geodatabases, shapefiles, or coverages, enclose field names in double quotes: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer.workspace
member.summary: The input workspace used to validate the field names. If the input is a geodatabase table and the output workspace is a dBASE table, the field names may be truncated, since dBASE fields can only have names of ten characters or less. The new names may be reviewed and altered using the field information control. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeFeatureLayer.field_info
member.summary: Can be used to review and alter the field names and hide a subset of fields in the output layer. A split policy can be specified. See the usages for more information. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The name of the feature class to be created. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.out_path
member.summary: The ArcSDE, file, or personal geodatabase, or the folder in which the output feature class will be created. This workspace must already exist. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.out_name
member.summary: The name of the feature class to be created. (In, Required)

member.summary: The geometry type of the feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.template
member.summary: The feature class used as a template to define the attribute schema of the feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.has_m
member.summary: Determines if the feature class contains linear measurement values (m-values). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.has_z
member.summary: Determines if the feature class contains elevation values (z-values). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.spatial_reference
member.summary: The spatial reference of the output feature class. You can specify the spatial reference in several ways: By entering the path to a .prj file, such as C:/workspace/watershed.prj. By referencing a feature class whose spatial reference you want to apply, such as C:/workspace/myproject.gdb/landuse/grassland . By defining a spatial reference object prior to defining the Create Feature Class function, such as sr = arcpy.SpatialReference("C:/data/Africa/Carthage.prj") which you then call in the Create Feature Class tool. Refer to the Stand-alone Code Sample below. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.config_keyword
member.summary: The configuration keyword applies to ArcSDE data only. It determines the storage parameters of the database table. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.spatial_grid_1
member.summary: The Spatial Grid 1, 2, and 3 parameters are used to compute a spatial index and only apply to file geodatabases and certain ArcSDE geodatabase feature classes. If you are unfamiliar with setting grid sizes, leave these options as 0,0,0 and ArcGIS will compute optimal sizes for you. Since no features are written by this tool, the spatial index will be in an unbuilt state. The index will be built when features are written to the feature class such as by the Append tool or editing operations. For more information about this parameter, refer to the Add Spatial Index tool documentation. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.spatial_grid_2
member.summary: Cell size of the second spatial grid. Leave the size at 0 if you only want one grid. Otherwise, set the size to at least three times larger than Spatial Grid 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFeatureclass.spatial_grid_3
member.summary:
Cell size of the third spatial grid. Leave the size at 0 if you only want two grids. Otherwise, set the size to at least three times larger than Spatial Grid 2.
(In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Feature Class (out, Optional)

member.summary: An SQL expression used to select a subset of records. The syntax for the expression differs slightly depending on the data source. For example, if you're querying file or ArcSDE geodatabases, shapefiles, coverages, dBase, or INFO tables, enclose field names in double quotes: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeTableView.workspace
member.summary: The input workspace used to validate the field names. The relationship class that is created. (Out, Required)

A name to uniquely identify the relationship when navigating from the destination table to the origin table. (In, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Dataset or feature class whose projection is to be defined. (In, Required)

Valid values are a file with a .prj extension (.prj files shipped with ArcGIS are available at the ArcGIS installation directory in the Coordinate System folder) or a string representation of a coordinate system. This string representation can be generated by adding a coordinate system variable to ModelBuilder, setting the variable's value as desired, then exporting the model to a Python script. If the input is a feature classâ€”features from the input feature class are projected to the new coordinate system and written to the output feature class.If the input is a feature datasetâ€”all feature classes in the input feature dataset will be projected to the new coordinate system and written to the output feature dataset.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology
member.summary: Adds a feature class to a topology.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The topology to which the feature class will participate. (In, Required)
The feature class that you want to add to the topology. The feature class must be in the same feature dataset as the topology. (In, Required)

The relative degree of positional accuracy associated with vertices of features in the feature class versus those in other feature classes participating in the topology. The feature class with the highest accurracy should get a higher rank (lower number, for example 1) than a feature class which is known to be less accurate. (In, Required)

Feature classes that are z-aware have elevation values embedded in their geometry for each vertex. By setting a z rank, you can influence how vertices with accurate z-values are snapped or clustered with vertices that contain less accurate z measurements. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology.in_topology
member.summary: The topology to which the feature class will participate. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology.in_featureclass
member.summary: The feature class that you want to add to the topology. The feature class must be in the same feature dataset as the topology. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology.xy_rank
member.summary: The relative degree of positional accuracy associated with vertices of features in the feature class versus those in other feature classes participating in the topology. The feature class with the highest accurracy should get a higher rank (lower number, for example 1) than a feature class which is known to be less accurate. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddFeatureClassToTopology.z_rank
member.summary: Feature classes that are z-aware have elevation values embedded in their geometry for each vertex. By setting a z rank, you can influence how vertices with accurate z-values are snapped or clustered with vertices that contain less accurate z measurements. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Integrate
member.summary: Integrate is used to maintain the integrity of shared feature boundaries by making features coincident if they fall within the specified x,y tolerance. Features that fall within the specified x,y tolerance are considered identical or coincident.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Integrate.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature classes to be integrated. When the distance between features is small in comparison to the tolerance the vertices or points will be clustered (moved to be coincident). The feature class or layer with the lower rank will snap to the feature from the feature class or layer with the higher rank (with 1 being a higher rank than 2). Note that features in the feature class with a rank of 1 may move when a large x,y tolerance is used. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Integrate.in_features
member.summary: The feature classes to be integrated. When the distance between features is small in comparison to the tolerance the vertices or points will be clustered (moved to be coincident). The feature class or layer with the lower rank will snap to the feature from the feature class or layer with the higher rank (with 1 being a higher rank than 2). Note that features in the feature class with a rank of 1 may move when a large x,y tolerance is used. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Integrate.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The distance that determines the range in which feature vertices are made coincident. To minimize undesired movement of vertices, the x,y tolerance should be fairly small. If no value is specified, the xy tolerance from the first dataset in the list of inputs will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Integrate.out_features
member.summary: Output Features (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare
member.summary: Compares two feature classes or layers and returns the comparison results. Feature Compare can report differences with geometry, tabular values, spatial reference, and field definitions.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The Input Base Features are compared with the Input Test Features. Input Base features refers to data that you have declared valid. This base data has the correct geometry definitions, field definitions, and spatial reference. (In, Required)
The Input Test Features are compared against the Input Base Features. Input Test Features refers to data that you have made changes to by editing or compiling new features. (In, Required)

The field or fields used to sort records in the Input Base Table and the Input Test Table. The records are sorted in ascending order. Sorting by a common field in both the Input Base Features and the Input Test Features ensures that you are comparing the same row from each input dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.in_base_features
member.summary: The Input Base Features are compared with the Input Test Features. Input Base features refers to data that you have declared valid. This base data has the correct geometry definitions, field definitions, and spatial reference. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.in_test_features
member.summary: The Input Test Features are compared against the Input Base Features. Input Test Features refers to data that you have made changes to by editing or compiling new features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.sort_field
member.summary: The field or fields used to sort records in the Input Base Table and the Input Test Table. The records are sorted in ascending order. Sorting by a common field in both the Input Base Features and the Input Test Features ensures that you are comparing the same row from each input dataset. (In, Required)

member.summary: These properties will not be compared during comparison. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.xy_tolerance
member.summary: The distance that determines the range in which features are considered equal. To minimize error, the value you choose for the compare tolerance should be as small as possible. By default, the compare tolerance is the XY Tolerance of the input base features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.m_tolerance
member.summary: The measure tolerance is the minimum distance between measures before they are considered equal. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.z_tolerance
member.summary: The Z Tolerance is the minimum distance between Z coordinates before they are considered equal. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureCompare.attribute_tolerances
member.summary: The numeric value that determines the range in which attribute values are considered equal. This only applies to numeric field types. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The field or fields that will be omitted during comparison. The field definitions and the tabular values for these fields will be ignored. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Indicates whether to compare all properties after encountering the first mismatch. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFishnet
member.summary: Creates a fishnet of rectangular cells. The output can be polyline or polygon features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFishnet.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The output feature class containing the fishnet of rectangular cells. (Out, Required)
The starting pivot point of the fishnet. (In, Required)
The Y-axis coordinate is used to orient the fishnet. The fishnet is rotated by the same angle as defined by the line connecting the origin and the y-axis coordiinate. (In, Required)

Determines the width of each cell. If you want the width to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Rows parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the width will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the height of each cell. If you want the height to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Columns parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the height will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the number of rows the fishnet will have. If you want the number of rows to be automatically calculated using the value in the Cell Size Width parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the number of rows will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the number of columns the fishnet will have. If you want the number of columns to be automatically calculated using the value in the Cell Size Height parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the number of rows will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFishnet.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class containing the fishnet of rectangular cells. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The starting pivot point of the fishnet. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateFishnet.cell_width
member.summary: Determines the width of each cell. If you want the width to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Rows parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the width will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

member.summary: Determines the height of each cell. If you want the height to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Columns parameter, set this value to zeroâ€”the height will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica
member.summary: Creates a replica to a personal, file, or SDE geodatabase from a specified list of feature classes, layers, datasets, and/or tables in an ArcSDE geodatabase.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The data to be replicated. This list consists of layers and tables referencing versioned, editable data from an ArcSDE geodatabase. (In, Required)
The kind of replica to create. (In, Required)

The local geodatabase or geodata service that will host the child replica. Geodata services are used to represent remote geodatabases. The geodatabase can be an ArcSDE, file, or personal geodatabase. For two-way replicas the child geodatabase must be ArcSDE. For one-way and check-out replicas the geodatabase can be personal, file, or ArcSDE. Personal or file geodatabases must already exist before running this tool. (In, Required)
The name that identifies the replica. (In, Required)

param.name: archiving
param.summary: Specifies whether to use the archive class to track changes instead of using the versioning delta tables. This is only available for one-way replicas. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.in_data
member.summary: The data to be replicated. This list consists of layers and tables referencing versioned, editable data from an ArcSDE geodatabase. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.in_type
member.summary: The kind of replica to create. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.out_geodatabase
member.summary: The local geodatabase or geodata service that will host the child replica. Geodata services are used to represent remote geodatabases. The geodatabase can be an ArcSDE, file, or personal geodatabase. For two-way replicas the child geodatabase must be ArcSDE. For one-way and check-out replicas the geodatabase can be personal, file, or ArcSDE. Personal or file geodatabases must already exist before running this tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.out_name
member.summary: The name that identifies the replica. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.access_type
member.summary: The type of access you want: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.initial_data_sender
member.summary: Used by replication to determine which replica can send changes when in disconnected mode. If you are working in a connected mode, this parameter is inconsequential. This ensures that the relative replica doesn't send updates until the changes are first received from the initial data sender. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.expand_feature_classes_and_tables
member.summary: Specifies whether you will include expanded feature classes and tables, such as those found in geometric networks, topologies, or relationship classes. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.reuse_schema
member.summary: Indicates whether to reuse a geodatabase that contains the schema of the data you want to replicate. This reduces the amount of time required to replicate the data. This option is only available for check-out replicas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.get_related_data
member.summary: Specifies whether to replicate rows related to rows already in the replica. For example, consider a feature (f1) inside the replication filter and a related feature (f2) from another class outside the filter. Feature f2 is included in the replica if you choose to get related data. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.geometry_features
member.summary: The features used to define the area to replicate. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplica.archiving
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the archive class to track changes instead of using the versioning delta tables. This is only available for one-way replicas. (In, Required)

member.summary: Output Child Workspace (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateReplicaFromServer
member.summary: Creates a replica using a specified list of feature classes, layers, feature datasets, and/or tables from a remote geodatabase using a geodata service published on ArcGIS Server.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The local geodatabase or geodata service that will host the child replica. Geodata services are used to represent remote geodatabases. The geodatabase can be an ArcSDE, file, or personal geodatabase. For two-way replicas the child geodatabase must be ArcSDE. For one-way and check-out replicas the geodatabase can be personal, file, or ArcSDE. Personal or file geodatabases must already exist before running this tool. (In, Required)
The name that identifies the replica. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges
member.summary: Synchronizes updates between two replica geodatabases in a direction specified by the user.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The geodatabase hosting the replica to synchronize. The geodatabase may be local or remote. (In, Required)
A valid replica with a parent contained within one input geodatabase and a child in the other input geodatabase. (In, Required)
The geodatabase hosting the relative replica. The geodatabase may be local or remote. (In, Required)

The direction in which you want changes to be sent: from geodatabase 1 to geodatabase 2, from geodatabase 2 to geodatabase 1, or to send changes in both directions. For check-out/check-in replicas or one-way replicas there is only one appropriate direction. If the replica is two-way then any of the three choices are available. (In, Required)
Specifies how conflicts are resolved when they are encountered. (In, Required)

param.name: conflict_definition
param.summary: Specifies how you would like to define conflicts: (In, Required)

param.name: reconcile
param.summary: Indicates whether to automatically reconcile once data changes are sent to the parent replica if there are no conflicts present. This option is only available for check-out/check-in replicas. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges.geodatabase_1
member.summary: The geodatabase hosting the replica to synchronize. The geodatabase may be local or remote. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges.in_replica
member.summary: A valid replica with a parent contained within one input geodatabase and a child in the other input geodatabase. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges.geodatabase_2
member.summary: The geodatabase hosting the relative replica. The geodatabase may be local or remote. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeChanges.in_direction
member.summary: The direction in which you want changes to be sent: from geodatabase 1 to geodatabase 2, from geodatabase 2 to geodatabase 1, or to send changes in both directions. For check-out/check-in replicas or one-way replicas there is only one appropriate direction. If the replica is two-way then any of the three choices are available. (In, Required)

member.summary: Random points will be generated inside or along the features in this feature class. The constraining feature class can be geometry type point, multipoint, line, or polygon. member.summary: Makes a copy of a raster dataset or loads raster datasets into a raster catalog.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The name and location of the raster dataset to be copied. (In, Required)
The name and location of the raster dataset to be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.in_raster
member.summary: The name and location of the raster dataset to be copied. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.out_rasterdataset
member.summary: The name and location of the raster dataset to be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.config_keyword
member.summary: Specifies the storage parameters (configuration) for a file geodatabase and an ArcSDE geodatabase. Personal geodatabases do not use configuration keywords. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.background_value
member.summary: Use this option to remove the unwanted values created around the raster data. The value specified will be distinguished from other valuable data in the raster dataset. For example, a value of zero along the raster dataset's borders will be distinguished from zero values within the raster dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.nodata_value
member.summary: All the pixels with the specified value will be set to NoData in the output raster dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.onebit_to_eightbit
member.summary: Choose whether the input 1-bit raster dataset will be converted to an 8-bit raster dataset. In this conversion the value 1 in the input raster dataset will be changed to 255 in the output raster dataset. This is useful when importing a 1-bit raster dataset to ArcSDE. One-bit raster dataset have 8-bit pyramid layers when stored in a file system, but in ArcSDE, 1-bit raster datasets can only have 1-bit pyramid layers, which makes the display unpleasant. By converting the data to 8-bit in ArcSDE, the pyramid layers are built as 8-bit instead of 1-bit, resulting in a proper raster dataset in the display. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.colormap_to_RGB
member.summary: If the input raster dataset has a colormap, the output raster dataset can be converted to a three-band output raster dataset. This is useful when mosaicking rasters with different colormaps. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CopyRaster.pixel_type
member.summary: Determines the bit depth of the output raster dataset. If left unspecified, the output bit depth will be the same as the input. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: Choose whether the input 1-bit raster dataset will be converted to an 8-bit raster dataset. In this conversion the value 1 in the input raster dataset will be changed to 255 in the output raster dataset. This is useful when importing a 1-bit raster dataset to ArcSDE. One-bit raster dataset have 8-bit pyramid layers when stored in a file system, but in ArcSDE, 1-bit raster datasets can only have 1-bit pyramid layers, which makes the display unpleasant. member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Mosaic.mosaicking_tolerance
member.summary: When mosaicking takes place, the target and the source pixels do not always line up exactly. When there is a misalignment of pixels, a decision needs to be made whether resampling takes place, or whether the data should be shifted. The mosaicking tolerance controls whether resampling of the pixels take place, or if the pixels should be shifted. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The Output Spatial Grid 1, 2, and 3 parameters apply only to file geodatabases and ArcSDE geodatabases. member.summary: The name of the input image service, or the URL that references the image service. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output extent of the image layer. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Choose which bands to export for the layer. If no bands are specified, then all the bands will be used in the output. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The mosaic method defines how the mosaic is created from different rasters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeImageServerLayer.order_field
member.summary: The default field to use to order the rasters when the mosaic method is ByAttribute. The list of fields is defined as those in the service table that are of type metadata and are integer (for example, the values can represent dates or cloud cover percentage). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeImageServerLayer.order_base_value
member.summary: The images are sorted based on the difference between this input value and attribute value in the specified field. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeImageServerLayer.lock_rasterid
member.summary: Raster ID or raster name to which the service should be locked, such that only the specified rasters are displayed. If left blank (undefined), it will be similar to system default. Multiple IDs can be defined as a semicolon-delimited list. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Dice
member.summary: Subdivides a feature into smaller features based on a specified vertex limit. This tool is intended as a way to subdivide extremely large features which cause issues with drawing, analysis, editing, and/or performance but are difficult to split up with standard editing and geoprocessing tools. This tool should not be used in any cases other than those where tools are failing to complete successfully due to the size of features.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or feature layer. The geometry type must be multipoint, line, or polygon. (In, Required)
The feature class which will be created and to which the result will be written (Out, Required)
Features with geometries which exceed this vertex limit will be subdivided before being written to the output feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical
member.summary: Reports any records in a feature class or table that have identical values in a list of fields, and generates a table listing these identical records. If the field 'Shape' is selected, feature geometries are compared.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The table or feature class for which identical records will be found. (In, Required)

The output table reporting any identical records. This table will have the same number of records as the input dataset and will contain two fields: IN_FID and FEAT_SEQ. Identical records have the same FEAT_SEQ value. (Out, Required)
The field(s) whose values will be compared to find identical records. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.in_dataset
member.summary: The table or feature class for which identical records will be found. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.out_dataset
member.summary: The output table reporting any identical records. This table will have the same number of records as the input dataset and will contain two fields: IN_FID and FEAT_SEQ. Identical records have the same FEAT_SEQ value. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.fields
member.summary: The field(s) whose values will be compared to find identical records. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.xy_tolerance
member.summary: The xy tolerance which will be applied to each vertex when evaluating if there is an identical vertex in another feature. This parameter is enabled only when 'Shape' is selected as one of the fields. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FindIdentical.z_tolerance

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BearingDistanceToLine
member.summary: This tool converts a table to two-point lines based on an x-coordinate field, y-coordinate field, bearing field, and distance field.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BearingDistanceToLine.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_table
param.summary: Table containing input parameters to create two-point lines based on a bearing and distance. Each row creates one line feature. (In, Required)

param.name: out_featureclass
param.summary: Output line feature class. (Out, Required)

param.name: x_field
param.summary: Input table field containing the x-values (longitude) of the starting point. (In, Required)

param.name: y_field
param.summary: Input table field containing the y-values (latitude) of the starting point. (In, Required)

param.name: distance_field
param.summary: Field in the input table containing values of the length of the output line. (In, Required)

param.name: distance_units
param.summary: Units of measurement of the Distance field. The default is METERS. (In, Required)

param.name: bearing_field
param.summary: Field in the input table containing direction values of the output line. (In, Required)

param.name: bearing_units
param.summary: Units of measurement of the Bearing field. The default is DEGREES. (In, Required)

param.name: line_type
param.summary: Type of two-point lines to construct. The default line type is GEODESIC. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BearingDistanceToLine.in_table
member.summary: Table containing input parameters to create two-point lines based on a bearing and distance. Each row creates one line feature. (In, Required)

member.summary: Output line feature class. (Out, Required)

member.summary: Input table field containing the x-values (longitude) of the starting point. (In, Required)

member.summary: Units of measurement of the Distance field. The default is METERS. (In, Required)

member.summary: Field in the input table containing direction values of the output line. (In, Required)

member.summary: Units of measurement of the Bearing field. The default is DEGREES. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse
member.summary: Converts a table (text file, CSV file, Excel file, dBASE table, or geodatabase table) containing coordinate and other required fields to a feature class. The output features are elliptical polygons. A single ellipse is generated from each row in the table. The features created are defined by a starting point, semi-major and semi-minor axis lengths, and rotation.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input table from which to generate ellipse features. (In, Required)

param.name: out_featureclass
param.summary: The output feature class that will contain the ellipse features. (Out, Required)

param.name: x_field
param.summary: The input table field containing the X (longitude) center point coordinate. (In, Required)

param.name: y_field
param.summary: The input table field containing the Y (latitude) center point coordinate. (In, Required)

param.name: major_field
param.summary: Field name containing (semi) major axis length values of the ellipses. (In, Required)

param.name: minor_field
param.summary: Field name containing (semi) minor axis length values of the ellipses. (In, Required)

param.name: distance_units
param.summary: The units of measure of the major and minor axes. METERS is the default. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.in_table
member.summary: The input table from which to generate ellipse features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.out_featureclass
member.summary: The output feature class that will contain the ellipse features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.x_field
member.summary: The input table field containing the X (longitude) center point coordinate. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.y_field
member.summary: The input table field containing the Y (latitude) center point coordinate. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.major_field
member.summary: Field name containing (semi) major axis length values of the ellipses. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.minor_field
member.summary: Field name containing (semi) minor axis length values of the ellipses. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.distance_units
member.summary: The units of measure of the major and minor axes. METERS is the default. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.azimuth_field
member.summary: Field name containing Azimuth (rotation) values for the ellipse. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.azimuth_units
member.summary: The measurement units of the values in the Azimuth Field. DEGREES is the default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.id_field
member.summary: ID field from the input table. This may be used to join the output features back to the input table. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TableToEllipse.spatial_reference
member.summary: The spatial reference of the input coordinates in the X Field and Y Field. This will become the spatial refrence of the output feature class. The default is GCS_WGS_1984. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertCoordinateNotation
member.summary: Converts a table containing point coordinate fields to a point feature class. The input table's coordinate fields can be in a variety of notations, such as GARS, UTM, and MGRS. The output point feature class also contains point coordinate fields in a coordinate notation of your choosing.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_table
param.summary: Table containing the coordinate field(s) to convert. (In, Required)

param.name: out_featureclass
param.summary: Output feature class of points. The attribute table will contain a field of the converted coordinates. (Out, Required)

param.name: x_field
param.summary: X coordinate field name in the Input Table. For DD and DDM this is the longitude field. For DMS, GARS, GEOREF, UTM, USNG, and MGRS, this is the only field as these are single-string coordinate types. (In, Required)

param.name: y_field
param.summary: Y coordinate field name in the input table. For DD and DDM this is the latitude field. This parameter is disabled for DMS, GARS, GEOREF, UTM, USNG, and MGRS. (In, Required)

param.name: input_coordinate_format
param.summary: Coordinate format of the input fields. The default is DD. (In, Required)

param.name: output_coordinate_format
param.summary: Format of the output coordinates in the output point feature class. The default is DD. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime
member.summary: Calculates the end time of features based on the time values stored in another field.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature class or table for which an End_Time field is calculated based on the Start_Time field specified. (In, Required)

The field containing values that will be used to calculate values for the End_Time field. The Start_Time field and the End_Time field must be of the same type. For example, if the Start_Time field is of type LONG, then the End_Time field should be of type LONG as well. (In, Required)
The field that will be populated with values based on the Start_Time field specified. The Start_Time field and the End_Time field must be of the same format. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.in_table
member.summary: The feature class or table for which an End_Time field is calculated based on the Start_Time field specified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.start_field
member.summary: The field containing values that will be used to calculate values for the End_Time field. The Start_Time field and the End_Time field must be of the same type. For example, if the Start_Time field is of type LONG, then the End_Time field should be of type LONG as well. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.end_field
member.summary: The field that will be populated with values based on the Start_Time field specified. The Start_Time field and the End_Time field must be of the same format. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.fields
member.summary: The name of the field or fields that can be used to uniquely identify spatial entities. These fields are used to first sort based on entity type if there is more than one entity. For instance, for a feature class representing population values per state over time, the state name could be the unique value field (the entity). If population figures are per county, you would need to set the county name and state name as the unique value fields, since some county names are the same for different states. If there is only one entity, this parameter can be ignored. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Table (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField
member.summary: Converts time values stored in a string or numeric field to a date field.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_table
param.summary: The layer or table that contains the field containing the time values that need to be converted and stored in the Date field. (In, Required)

param.name: input_time_field
param.summary: The field containing the time values. May be of type short, long, float, double, or text. (In, Required)

param.name: input_time_format
param.summary: The format in which the time values were stored in the input time field. Either a standard time format can be selected from the drop-down list, or a custom format can be entered. If the data type of the time field is numeric (Short, Long, Float, or Double), a list of standard numeric time formats is provided in the drop-down list. If the data type of the time field is string, a list of standard string time formats is provided in the drop-down list. For string fields, you can also choose to specify a custom time format. For example, the time values may have been stored in a string field in one of the standard formats such as yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss or in a custom format such as dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss. For the custom format, you can also specify the AM, PM designator. (In, Required)

param.name: output_time_field
param.summary: The name of output field. The output field created will be of type Date. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.in_table
member.summary: The layer or table that contains the field containing the time values that need to be converted and stored in the Date field. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.input_time_field
member.summary: The field containing the time values. May be of type short, long, float, double, or text. (In, Required)

member.summary: The format in which the time values were stored in the input time field. Either a standard time format can be selected from the drop-down list, or a custom format can be entered. If the data type of the time field is numeric (Short, Long, Float, or Double), a list of standard numeric time formats is provided in the drop-down list. If the data type of the time field is string, a list of standard string time formats is provided in the drop-down list. For string fields, you can also choose to specify a custom time format. For example, the time values may have been stored in a string field in one of the standard formats such as yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss or in a custom format such as dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss. For the custom format, you can also specify the AM, PM designator. (In, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeZone.input_dst
member.summary: Indicates whether the time stamps were collected while observing Daylight Saving Time rules in the input time zone. When reading the time values to convert the time zone, the time values will be adjusted to account for the shift in time during Daylight Saving Time. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TransposeFields
member.summary: Shifts data entered in fields or columns into rows in a table or feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TransposeFields.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or table for which the fields containing data values will be transposed. (In, Required)
The fields or columns containing data values in the input table that need to be transposed. (In, Required)

The output feature class or table. The output feature class or table will contain the transposed field, a value field, and any number of attribute fields specified that need to be inherited from the input table. (Out, Required)
The name of the field that will be created to store field name values of the fields that are selected to be transposed. Any valid field name can be used. (In, Required)

The name of the value field that will be created to store the values from the input table. Any valid field name can be set, as long as it does not conflict with existing field names from the input table or feature class. (In, Required)
